thread.section_title: About.com Eastern Europe Travel: What's Hot Now
thread.title: Eastern Europe in September

title: Eastern Europe in September
text:
Prague in September 
The St. Wenceslas Festival of Sacred Arts Music and the Prague Autumn Music Festival both take place in Prague. Even if this type of music isn't your thing, many people agree that September is one of the best months for traveling to Prague - the weather's gorgeous and you'll have an easier time getting into main attractions. The next time you plan a trip to Prague, consider this month for its weather and events. More » The Elizabeth Bridge over the Danube in Budapest. CC BY-NC-ND pansy_burke Budapest in September 
The aptly named Szeptemberfeszt and an international wine festival grace Budapest's September events calendar. September is a great time to sample the flavors and spirits of Hungary. Enjoy a glass of wine while the sun sets, or find a cozy restaurant in which to enjoy Budapest's yummiest national dishes, which pair well with autumn weather. More » Warsaw's Historic Center. CC BY-SA martinroell Warsaw in September 
A variety of festivals are featured in September in Warsaw, including the Festival of Jewish Culture, the Festival of Circus Arts, and the Science Festival. Strolling the old town area is pleasant during this month, and local restaurants serve up dishes made with the season's favorite crop: mushrooms. More » Bratislava in Autumn. CC BY-NC-ND Hortolano Bratislava in September 
Two interesting cultural events occur during September in Bratislava: the Old Craftsman's days, featuring demonstrations and crafts that take visitors back in time, and a coronation ceremony at St. Martin's Cathedral. If you're interested in Slovakia's history and culture, September is the perfect month to get experience with each. More » Krakow in September. CC BY-NC-SA Walker* 
A busy calendar of events, including a dachshund parade, and lovely autumn weather make September an ideal month for travel to Krakow. More » Moscow Rainbow. CC BY Aided_Eye 
Visit Red Square, the Kremlin, or other Moscow sights in September to enjoy the early fall in Russia's capital city. Park areas, monasteries, and other outdoor attractions are welcoming during this month. More » Ljubljana in September. CC BY Her Own Journey Ljubljana in September 
You'll love exploring Ljubljana during the month of September. Be sure to take advantage of the outdoor market, visit Ljubljana castle, and treat yourself to a rich pastry and a coffee in one of Ljubljana's cafes. Check an events calendar well in advance of your trip to find evening performances or museum exhibitions that you can take advantage of. More »
